title: Miguel Ãngel Borja es buscado de Arabia, pero en River Plate no cae bien su salida - GolCaracol

author: @baptistpress
title: Las ofrendas al PC hasta julio son algo mÃ¡s del 2 por ciento inferiores a las necesidades | Baptist Press
text: NASHVILLE (BP) â€“ En julio, las aportaciones al Programa Cooperativo se situaron un 8.06 por ciento por debajo de los objetivos mensuales. En total, los ingresos del PC se situaron un 2.36 por ciento por debajo de las necesidades presupuestarias del aÃ±o. Los totales de julio fueron algo mÃ¡s de $38.000 menos que los de julio de 2023. Las donaciones destinadas a fines especÃ­ficos superan en un 75 por ciento las del aÃ±o pasado, con algo mÃ¡s de 7.7 millones de dÃ³lares en julio. Donaciones del Programa Cooperativo Nacional en julio: Â§ Importe mensual presupuestado: $15.543.000 Â§ Aportaciones en julio de 2024: $14.290.299.62 Â§ Por encima/por debajo del presupuesto: $1.252.700.38 (8.06 por ciento) por debajo del presupuesto AportaciÃ³n total del Programa Nacional Cooperativo: Â§ Importe presupuestado hasta la fecha $163.619.000 Â§ Aportaciones hasta la fecha: $159.762.270.31 Â§ Por encima o por debajo del presupuesto: $3.856.729.69 (2.36 por ciento) por debajo del presupuesto. Aportaciones especÃ­ficas: Â§ Aportaciones de julio: $7.764.990.62 Â§ Aportaciones hasta la fecha: $191.026.635.32 Â§ Total del aÃ±o anterior hasta la fecha: $189.609.593.08 Â§ Por encima/por debajo del aÃ±o anterior: $1.417.042.24 (.75 por ciento) por encima del aÃ±o anterior. El presupuesto aprobado por la ConvenciÃ³n para 2023-2024 asciende a $195.250.000 e incluye una asignaciÃ³n prioritaria especial de $250.000 para la iniciativa VisiÃ³n 2025 del SBC. Los fondos del Programa Cooperativo se desembolsan de la siguiente manera: Â§ 50.41 por ciento a misiones internacionales a travÃ©s de la Junta de Misiones Internacionales Â§ 22.79 por ciento a las misiones norteamericanas a travÃ©s de la Junta de Misiones Norteamericanas. Â§ 22.16 por ciento a la educaciÃ³n teolÃ³gica a travÃ©s de los seis seminarios de la SBC y la Biblioteca y Archivos HistÃ³ricos Bautistas del Sur. Â§ 2.99 por ciento al presupuesto operativo de la SBC. Â§ 1.65 por ciento a la ComisiÃ³n de Ã‰tica y Libertad Religiosa. Si las donaciones nacionales del PC exceden la proyecciÃ³n presupuestaria al final del aÃ±o fiscal, el saldo del excedente se distribuye de acuerdo con los porcentajes aprobados para la distribuciÃ³n presupuestaria. El ComitÃ© Ejecutivo de la SBC distribuye todas las ofrendas del PC y designadas que recibe semanalmente a las entidades ministeriales de la SBC. Los aportes al presupuesto de asignaciÃ³n del PC recibidos por el ComitÃ© Ejecutivo se comunican mensualmente a los ejecutivos de las entidades de la convenciÃ³n, a las oficinas de las convenciones estatales, a los periÃ³dicos bautistas estatales y se publican en lÃ­nea en sbc.net/cp.

author: Iwona Majkowska
title: Graphite One Achieves Debt-Free Status Through Royalty Sale and Further Incentivizes Team
text:
Graphite One Achieves Debt-Free Status Through Royalty Sale and Further Incentivizes Team
Summary: Graphite One Inc. has made significant strides in improving its financial standing and rewarding corporate performance. By selling a royalty interest and through the granting of various long-term incentives to its team, the mining company looks to bolster its business operations and sustain growth.
Graphite One Inc., a mining company, recently reported that Taiga Mining Company, Inc. purchased a 1% Net Smelter Production Royalty (NSR) related to certain Alaskan state claims owned by Graphite One. This sale has allowed Graphite One to pay off existing debts as they enter the fiscal year 2024. The NSR begins as soon as the first mineral concentrates are produced and extends for a twenty-year term, marking a significant milestone in the companyâ€™s monetization of its assets.
In addition to the royalty sale, Graphite One also announced the issuance of restricted share units (RSUs), performance share units (PSUs), and stock options to its officers. This move underlines the companyâ€™s dedication to fostering a culture of performance and achievement. These incentives are designed to vest over time and are contingent upon meeting certain corporate goals, aligning the interests of the officers with those of the company and its shareholders.
The graphite producer is also investing in the development of a comprehensive U.S.-based supply chain for advanced graphite materials, including a manufacturing plant for battery anodes and a recycling facility as part of its circular economy strategy. This will help address the United Statesâ€™ reliance on imported natural graphite, potentially reshaping the countryâ€™s material sourcing for battery production.
With these strategic financial moves and the incentivization of its key personnel, Graphite One is positioning itself for sustainable operational and financial success in the expanding battery materials market.
FAQ Section:
1. What is Graphite One Inc. and what does it specialize in?
Graphite One Inc. is a mining company that specializes in the production of graphite. It is also investing in developing a comprehensive U.S.-based supply chain for advanced graphite materials, including manufacturing facilities for battery anodes and recycling.
2. What recent financial move has Graphite One made?
Graphite One recently sold a 1% Net Smelter Production Royalty (NSR) to Taiga Mining Company, Inc. The royalty is tied to certain Alaskan state claims and has helped Graphite One improve its financial situation by allowing it to pay off debts.
3. What is an NSR?
Net Smelter Production Royalty (NSR) is a type of financial agreement that provides the holder with a percentage of revenue from the minerals produced and sold by the mining operation after deducting certain expenses.
4. How long is the term for the NSR?
The NSR sold by Graphite One covers a twenty-year term and becomes active when the first mineral concentrates are produced.
5. What are the long-term incentives Graphite One has granted to its team?
Graphite One has granted restricted share units (RSUs), performance share units (PSUs), and stock options to its officers as long-term incentives. These are meant to vest over time and depend on achieving specific corporate goals.
6. How will the incentives benefit the company?
The incentives are designed to align the interests of the companyâ€™s officers with those of the company and its shareholders, fostering a culture of performance and achievement.
7. What is the strategic significance of Graphite Oneâ€™s investments in the U.S. supply chain for graphite?
Graphite Oneâ€™s investments in a U.S.-based supply chain for advanced graphite materials are significant because they aim to reduce the United Statesâ€™ reliance on imported natural graphite, which is crucial for battery production.
Definitions:
â€“ Graphite: A naturally occurring form of crystalline carbon that is used in batteries, steelmaking, brake linings, foundry facings, and lubricants.
â€“ Net Smelter Production Royalty (NSR): A type of mining royalty that gives the owner a percentage of the gross revenue from the sale of mined minerals, less deductions for certain expenses like transportation and refining.
â€“ Restricted Share Units (RSUs): A form of company equity compensation subject to a vesting period, after which the employee receives shares of the company stock.
â€“ Performance Share Units (PSUs): A type of stock grant that vests only if certain performance criteria are met.
â€“ Stock Options: Contracts that grant the holder the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell shares of a stock at a specific price within a specific time period.
Suggested Related Links:
â€“ To learn more about the battery materials market, visit
Bloomberg.
â€“ For information on mining companies and industry news, you might explore
Mining.com.
â€“ To understand more about the United States mineral strategies and policies, check out the official website of the U.S. Department of the Interior at
DOI.
Iwona Majkowska is a prominent figure in the tech industry, renowned for her expertise in new technologies, artificial intelligence, and solid-state batteries. Her work, often at the forefront of innovation, provides critical insights into the development and application of cutting-edge AI solutions and the evolution of energy storage technologies. Majkowskaâ€™s contributions are pivotal in shaping the future of sustainable energy and intelligent systems, making her a respected voice in both academic and industrial circles. Her articles and research papers are a valuable resource for professionals and enthusiasts alike, seeking to understand the impact and potential of these transformative technologies.
